sentence.Network_en: I had to matriculate if I wanted to do a degree.

sentence.Network_cn: 这就是为什么有40%的学生要半工半读.

sentence.Network_cn: 假如让她当讲师, 以后她就要成为教授, 甚至进大学评议会.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from medieval Latin matriculat- 'enrolled', from the verb matriculare, from late Latin matricula 'register', diminutive of Latin matrix

entry.def: In some countries, if you matriculate, you register formally as a student at a university, or you satisfy the academic requirements necessary for registration for a course.

example.ex: I had to matriculate if I wanted to do a degree.
example.tran: 如果我想攻读学位，必须先被录取入学。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who has been admitted to a college or university

sentences.en: He had been matriculated in the university.
Three years later he matriculated for advance study.
